text: Francisco Gento López (21 October 1933 - 18 January 2022) was a Spanish football player. He played for Spain national team. ==Death== Gento died in Madrid, Spain on 18 January 2022, aged 88.Muere Francisco Gento, leyenda del Real Madrid y único futbolista con 6 Copas de Europa ==Career statistics== ===Club=== Appearances and goals by club, season and competition Club Season League Copa del Rey Europe Other Total Division Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Racing Santander 1952–53 Primera División 10 2 4 1 — — 14 3 Real Madrid 1953–54 Primera División 17 0 4 0 — — 21 0 1954–55 24 6 3 0 — 2 0 29 6 1955–56 29 7 6 3 7 1 — 42 11 1956–57 27 7 3 0 8 1 2 3 40 11 1957–58 28 7 5 1 6 3 — 39 11 1958–59 21 7 4 2 8 1 — 33 10 1959–60 27 15 5 3 6 2 — 38 20 1960–61 28 9 8 3 2 1 1 1 39 14 1961–62 25 6 9 4 9 2 — 43 12 1962–63 25 7 4 1 2 1 — 31 9 1963–64 24 12 2 0 9 3 — 35 15 1964–65 23 4 3 0 6 5 — 32 9 1965–66 28 10 3 2 9 3 — 40 15 1966–67 20 11 5 0 4 0 1 0 30 11 1967–68 24 8 1 0 7 5 — 32 13 1968–69 26 8 2 1 2 0 — 30 9 1969–70 24 3 4 1 3 3 — 31 7 1970–71 7 0 2 0 6 0 — 15 0 Total 427 127 73 21 94 31 6 4 600 183 Career total 437 129 78 22 94 31 6 4 614 186 ===International=== Appearances and goals by national team and year National team Year Apps Goals Spain 1955 1 0 1956 1 0 1957 7 0 1958 2 0 1959 5 1 1960 4 0 1961 7 1 1962 6 0 1963 3 1 1966 3 1 1967 2 1 1968 2 0 1969 1 0 Total 44 5 :Scores and results list Spain's goal tally first, score column indicates score after each Gento goal. List of international goals scored by Francisco Gento No. Date Venue Opponent Score Result Competition 1 14 October 1959 Santiago Bernabéu Stadium, Madrid, Spain 3–0 3–0 1960 European Nations' Cup qualifying 2 2 April 1961 Santiago Bernabéu Stadium, Madrid, Spain 2–0 2–0 Friendly 3 30 October 1963 Windsor Park, Belfast, Northern Ireland 1–0 1–0 1964 European Nations' Cup qualifying 4 23 June 1966 Riazor, A Coruña, Spain 1–1 1–1 Friendly 5 31 May 1967 San Mamés, Bilbao, Spain 2–0 2–0 UEFA Euro 1968 qualifying ==Honours== Real Madrid *La Liga (12): 1953–54, 1954–55, 1956–57, 1957–58, 1960–61, 1961–62, 1962–63, 1963–64, 1964–65, 1966–67, 1967–68, 1968–69 *Copa del Generalísimo: 1961–62, 1969–70 *European Cup (6): 1955–56, 1956–57, 1957–58, 1958–59, 1959–60, 1965–66 *Intercontinental Cup: 1960 ;Semi-official *Latin Cup: 1955, 1957 ;Non- official *Small Club World Cup: 1956 Individual *World Soccer World XI: 1960, 1961, 1962"ERIC BATTY’S WORLD XI – THE SIXTIES" Retrieved on 29 November 2015 *Golden Foot Legends Award: 2004 *World Soccer: The 100 Greatest Footballers of All Time *IFFHS Legends Records *Most La Liga titles: 12 *Most European Cup titles: 6 *Most European Cup final appearances: 8 (tied with Paolo Maldini) ==References== Category:1933 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Spanish footballers Category:Spanish football managers Category:CD Castellón managers
